metadata.title: CVE-2017-6306 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in ytnef before 1.9.1. This is related to a patchdescribed as "9 of 9. Directory Traversal using the filename;SanitizeFilename function in settings.c."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6306` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libytnef0 - 1.9.1-1
ytnef-tools - 1.9.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libytnef package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.1-1').
